newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves to banking system as expected.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves to banking system as expected.

text.p: The Federal Reserve, as expected, added reserves to the banking system via a round of overnight system repurchase agreements on Wednesday, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York confirmed.
Economists have not ruled out the possibility the Fed might permanently inject reserves into the system via an outright purchase of securities.
Fed funds were trading at the Fed's current official target level of 5-1/2 percent.
